etymologies: mid 19th century: from French décalcomanie, from décalquer ‘transfer a tracing’ + -manie ‘-mania’ (with reference to the enthusiasm for the process in the 1860s)

definitions: the process of transferring designs from prepared paper on to glass or porcelain.
shortDefinitions: process of transferring designs from prepared paper on to glass or porcelain

definitions: a technique used by some surrealist artists which involves pressing paint between sheets of paper.
shortDefinitions: technique used by some surrealist artists which involves pressing paint between sheets of paper
